Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements accurately reflects the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) The activity is a standard medical procedure with no research component.
B) The activity is a commercial service offered to the general public.
C) The activity is part of a research study involving micro-ultrasound imaging for prostate cancer.
D) The activity is a routine health check-up unrelated to research.

Correct answer: C) The activity is part of a research study involving micro-ultrasound imaging for prostate cancer.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the research study described in the consent form?
A) To evaluate the effectiveness of a new prostate cancer medication; B) To assess the accuracy of a new blood pressure monitoring device; C) To develop better tools for prostate cancer detection using micro-ultrasound imaging; D) To compare the effectiveness of different surgical techniques for prostatectomy.

Correct answer: C

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How much time is anticipated for your active participation in the imaging portion of the study?
A) Approximately 2 minutes; B) Approximately 30 minutes; C) Approximately 1 hour; D) Approximately 15 minutes
Correct answer: A

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the costs of participating in the Predicting Location and Extent of Prostate Cancer using Micro-Ultrasound Imaging study?
A) Participants will be charged for the use of the ExactVu device during the study.
B) Participants will receive a stipend for their time involved in the study.
C) Participants will not incur any costs for participating in the study.
D) Participants will be responsible for the costs of any additional treatments required due to complications from the study.

Correct answer: C) Participants will not incur any costs for participating in the study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What will happen during your participation in the prostate cancer study using micro-ultrasound imaging?

A) You will undergo a full surgical procedure to remove the prostate.
B) You will be asked to complete a series of physical fitness tests.
C) The ExactVu device will be used to take ultrasound images of your prostate before a biopsy or surgery.
D) You will be required to stay in the hospital for a 24-hour observation period.

Correct answer: C) The ExactVu device will be used to take ultrasound images of your prostate before a biopsy or surgery.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What happens if you choose to withdraw from the research study after consenting to participate?
A) You will be required to pay a penalty fee for withdrawing; B) You may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled; C) Your health insurance will be cancelled; D) You will be obligated to continue participating in other unrelated research studies.

Correct answer: B

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants is the research study aiming to enroll?
A) 50 participants; B) 100 participants; C) 150 participants; D) 200 participants
Correct answer: B) 100 participants

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are the potential risks associated with participating in the micro-ultrasound imaging study for prostate cancer detection?
A) Significant risk of radiation exposure; B) High likelihood of severe allergic reactions; C) Minimal to none, with no anticipated harm; D) Risk of long-term tissue damage

Correct answer: C

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the potential benefits of participating in the prostate cancer micro-ultrasound imaging study?
A) Participants will receive financial compensation for their involvement in the study.
B) Participants will directly benefit from improved prostate cancer detection during the study.
C) Participants' involvement may help develop better diagnostic tools for future prostate cancer patients.
D) Participants will receive a guarantee of personal health improvement as a result of the study.

Correct answer: C) Participants' involvement may help develop better diagnostic tools for future prostate cancer patients.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What are the alternative options available to you if you choose not to participate in the micro-ultrasound imaging study for prostate cancer detection?
A) You can opt for a standard prostate biopsy without the use of the ExactVu device; B) You will be required to undergo an MRI scan instead; C) Participation in the study is mandatory for all prostate cancer patients at Stanford; D) You will be provided with a full-body CT scan as an alternative.

Correct answer: A

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your personal health information will be handled in the Predicting Location and Extent of Prostate Cancer using Micro-Ultrasound Imaging study?
A) Your health information will be shared publicly on the internet without restrictions.
B) Your health information may be used or disclosed by the research team, but will not be disclosed to parties outside of the research without your consent.
C) Your health information may be used by the research team and disclosed to certain parties involved in the research, but your identity will not be disclosed in any scientific meetings or publications.
D) Your health information will be kept completely confidential and will not be used or disclosed for any purpose.

Correct answer: C) Your health information may be used by the research team and disclosed to certain parties involved in the research, but your identity will not be disclosed in any scientific meetings or publications.

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury or illness directly caused by your participation in the prostate cancer study, who is primarily responsible for the costs of care?

A) The study will cover all related costs of care for any injury.
B) Your insurer, managed care plan, or other benefits program will be billed first.
C) You will receive full compensation from Stanford University for any injury-related costs.
D) All medical costs will be out-of-pocket, with no assistance from the study or your insurance.

Correct answer: B) Your insurer, managed care plan, or other benefits program will be billed first.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience any issues or injuries related to the study, whom should you contact for assistance?
A) Your personal physician; B) The Stanford Institutional Review Board (IRB); C) The Protocol Director, Geoffrey Sonn, MD; D) The Clinical Research Coordinator, Ned Realiza
Correct answer: C) The Protocol Director, Geoffrey Sonn, MD

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your right to withdraw from the study?

A) Withdrawing from the study will result in a penalty.
B) You may withdraw your consent at any time without any impact on your medical care outside the study.
C) Refusal to participate will result in the loss of benefits you are entitled to.
D) You are obligated to complete the study once you consent to participate.

Correct answer: B) You may withdraw your consent at any time without any impact on your medical care outside the study.
